channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-17021] Use RingBuffer to reduce the contention in AsyncFSWAL
item.description: The WALPE result in HBASE-16890 shows that with disruptor's RingBuffer we can get a better performance.
item.summary: Use RingBuffer to reduce the contention in AsyncFSWAL

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Use ringbuffer instead of ArrayDeque in AsyncFSWAL to reduce contention.

The rolling logic is also reimplemented. Now we will only wait for the ack of all out-going appends, will not try to write out all the pending appends before rolling.

Unify AsyncFSWAL.Payload to RingBufferTruck, and also add tracing for AsyncFSWAL.append.

Fix a simple bug that we do not reset numEntries after rolling.

I set the default WAL to asyncfs in the patch. Just want to see the precommit test result to find out bugs. Will revert to filesystem when commit.

stack ramkrishna.s.vasudevan, PTAL. Thanks.
Are you sure that contention was the only problem with AsyncFSWAL and its slower performance?

-1 overall

At least one of the problems...

stack If you can also make sure that this patch helps, then let's commit it first?

Then I could work on the following part such as limit the concurrent sync requests. I do not want to put everything in a single big patch as we do not know if the newly added code works...

Thanks.
I did a part-pass. Will do another later. ramkrishna.s.vasudevan You looking at this. Whats diff between this and your aproach boss? Thanks.

I could not track the comments for today. I wil check them.
My patch now does a simple thing. Instead of increasing the txid inside the append/sync API under the critical section, I call the RingBuffer and in the onEvent() method I increment the txid.
Rest of the code remains same as what Duo had written wrt AsyncWAL.
The problem is that in the append() API the txid That is return is not the actual txid and it cannot be used. The sync API that accepts txid sync(txid) just ignores what was passed.
Also the SyncFuture is not constructed with the txid where as the oneVent() sets the txid on the SyncFuture.
This is my patch for your reference.

Fix a typo that causes the roll logic broken...

In consume method, writer.getLength() >= fileLengthAtLastSync should be writer.getLength() > fileLengthAtLastSync...
Seems the pre commit job did not run. Retry.

stack ramkrishna.s.vasudevan As this patch could fix the contention and unexpected wal roll, let's commit it first?

I will do some other changes to see if I can make AsyncFSWAL run faster for a single node HDFS. For me, the WALPE is OK but in PE AsyncFSWAL is much slower.

Thanks.

Some more questions on the FanoutDFSOutputStream


    int trailingPartialChunkLen = dataLen % summer.getBytesPerChecksum();

    ByteBuf newBuf = alloc.directBuffer().ensureWritable(trailingPartialChunkLen);

    if (trailingPartialChunkLen != 0) {

      buf.readerIndex(dataLen - trailingPartialChunkLen).readBytes(newBuf, trailingPartialChunkLen);

    }

    buf.release();

    this.buf = newBuf;

This does a copy I believe. And in case of netty bytebufs as and when we write data to it how does the bytebuf grow? How costly are those operations?

The alloc itself is not very expensive as netty will use a pool. But I think the copies when ByteBuf grow maybe expensive as the data we need to copy will also increase. Maybe we should set a larger initial size instead of using the default 256B.

I just tried out a PE run without checksum. I set dfs.checksum.type to NULL. I still see AsyncWAL is twice slower.

But I think the copies when ByteBuf grow maybe expensive as the data we need to copy will also increase. Maybe we should set a larger initial size instead of using the default 256B.

I could see some Unsafe copies that are prominent now. Let me try with a patch for that.

Address the comment on rb. Will commit after the precommit passes. Of course, will change the default WAL back to FSHLog when commit.

Thanks.

-1 overall
